thread.title: Hollyoaks newcomer David Easter: 'Massive Cindy and Mac secret will be revealed' - Hollyoaks Soaps
thread.title_full: Hollyoaks newcomer David Easter: 'Massive Cindy and Mac secret will be revealed' - Hollyoaks News - Soaps - Digital Spy

author: Daniel Kilkelly
title: Hollyoaks newcomer David Easter: 'Massive Cindy and Mac secret will be revealed' - Hollyoaks Soaps
text: Hollyoaks newcomer David Easter has revealed that there is more to learn about his character Mac Nightingale's connection to Cindy Cunningham.Mac was first introduced to the Channel 4 show in the spring when he made a brief appearance as Cindy's secret husband, but he's now returning as a show regular who'll be taking over The Dog in the Pond. © Lime PicturesDavid Easter as Mac Nightingale The pub's new landlord moves to the village with his family and his fiancée Neeta Kaur, but the only problem is that Cindy has swept his request for a divorce under the rug.Speaking to Soaplife about the storyline, Easter explained: "He knew Cindy a long time ago. During one of her breakdown periods, they met up and went on a mad bender. They went on holiday, got very drunk and ended up getting married. They both knew it was a mistake at the time."Asked why Cindy is secretly delaying the divorce, he replied: "We don't really know at the moment. She didn't sign the annulment papers after he turned up asking for a divorce earlier this year."Mac's a wealthy man and his family get whatever they want, so there may be something else Cindy is after. There's also a massive secret regarding Cindy and Mac set to be revealed." © Lime PicturesWhat is Cindy up to? Easter added that he is delighted to finally be part of the Hollyoaks cast after auditioning for other parts in the past.He said: "I've done Brookside, Family Affairs and Emmerdale, but I've always loved Hollyoaks and I've auditioned quite a few times, but always missed out. I was thrilled to get this part and it's absolutely brilliant. It feels very different and it's just like being part of a family."I've signed up for a year and I'd love to stay for as long as they want me."Hollyoaks is celebrating its 20th anniversary all week on Channel 4 and E4.Fresh faces for Hollyoaks: Meet the brand new Nightingale family who are taking over The DogHollyoaks newcomer David Easter on future stories: 'Mac will be devastated'Hollyoaks newcomer Sophie Porley: 'Ellie Nightingale is a fun bitch'Hollyoaks newcomer Jared Garfield: 'The Nightingales have been through a lot'Hollyoaks producer Emily Gascoyne on new Nightingale family: 'We've neglected the student element'Hollyoaks 20th anniversary spoilers: Jack Osborne will announce that he's sold the pubHollyoaks boss Bryan Kirkwood: 'The Nightingales will create a sense of community'Read more Hollyoaks spoilers and newsDigital Spy Soap Scoop video - hit play below for gossip on EastEnders' Halloween special, Nikhil's Emmerdale return, the Nightingale family's arrival in Hollyoaks and a new romance story for Mary in Coronation Street. function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID);
